Frequently Asked Questions

What do you mean by Indian Fonts?

Indian fonts are fonts that come with rich cultural designs that draw inspiration from Indian culture. If you want to add an artistic touch to your designs, you will require Indian fonts.

Which of the above-said Indian fonts has got ritual symbols of Buddhism in its designs?

Maverick is the Indian font that has ritual symbols of Buddhism in its designs

Which of the above said fonts takes its inspiration from a trip to Kerala?

Hakedita is a modern calligraphy font that takes its inspiration from Kerala.

Which of the above-said fonts is inspired by Indian Incense sticks?

Mantra is a classic Indian font that draws inspiration from Indian Incense sticks.

Which of the above-said font was created with the idea of the Indian fire festival?

Happy Lohri is a stylish, outstanding font that draws inspiration from the Indian Fire festival.

What is the official font of India?

India doesn't have an officially mandated font for all documents, but Times New Roman is widely used for legal documents and official notices. Some government departments also use Arial and other standard fonts for consistency and readability.

What is the most famous Hindu text?

The Bhagavata Purana is one of the most celebrated and influential texts in the Puranic genre. It emphasizes bhakti (devotion) toward Krishna and holds a central place in Krishna bhakti literature, shaping Hindu devotional traditions.
